text:
CANDIDATE 		Adam Tither
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		North West – Oldham
QUALIFICATIONS
Meng Chemical Engineering – 2020 University of Birmingham
Achieved a 2:1 in a Masters Chemical Engineering Degree
Attained a high 2:1 in a recent design project which involved minimising the environmental impact of the plastic recycling process. This involved designing a process which would be less energy-intensive than existing methods, then producing a business plan, analysing every aspect of the process, and reviewing the economics and risks of the design
Obtained a 2:1 in a design project focusing on the detailed design of a vertical stirred mill for a kaolin production process. This involved design calculations, mass and energy balances, defining control systems, mechanical drawings and cost analysi CANDIDATE 		Adam Tither
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		North West – Oldham
QUALIFICATIONS
Meng Chemical Engineering – 2020 University of Birmingham
Achieved a 2:1 in a Masters Chemical Engineering Degree
Attained a high 2:1 in a recent design project which involved minimising the environmental impact of the plastic recycling process. This involved designing a process which would be less energy-intensive than existing methods, then producing a business plan, analysing every aspect of the process, and reviewing the economics and risks of the design
Obtained a 2:1 in a design project focusing on the detailed design of a vertical stirred mill for a kaolin production process. This involved design calculations, mass and energy balances, defining control systems, mechanical drawings and cost analysis
Gained expertise with AutoCAD, MATLAB, Pro II, Simulink, COMSOL, and Microsoft Office
CAREER SUMMARY
Aug 2020 to date Projex Solutions Limited
Position: Graduate Process Engineer
Working as a Project Engineer on a range of projects across chemical, energy, pharmaceutical and FCMG sectors. Responsibilities so far have included:
Project managing and working with sub-contractors
Conducting relief study calculations and identifying areas of improvement for relief systems
Performing Hazardous Area Classification (HAC) calculations
Reviewing P&IDs onsite and updating them to as-built status
Developing AutoCAD skills through providing technical drawings, including P&IDs, equipment layouts and hazardous area zoning
Updating process schedules and data sheets
Broadening knowledge of industrial engineering standards (API 2000, HSG176, ASME)
Jun to Sep 2019 Exloc Instruments UK
Position: Sales and Marketing Assistant
Worked in a team to design the company brochure for a Functional Safety Engineering Course, ensuring it was effective for advertising purposes - this was successful because the course ended up being fully booked
Demonstrated communication skills by managing emails and answering calls. Improved ability to communicate concisely and answer questions clearly and correctly
Took deliveries of stock order from suppliers and used spreadsheets to redistribute stock to customers
Displayed good customer service and sales skills
Populated company databases and spreadsheets, improving my ability to use excel
Jun–Sep 2018 University of Birmingham
Position: Student Intern
Conducted in-depth interviews with lecturers about educational technology and showed initiative to seek out specialists within the department to discuss ideas and get their input
Created a series of online applications, providing students with the opportunity to self-learn in a supported environment with key additional skills for the area of employment they wish to pursue upon graduating
Supported the planning and creation of online teaching, assessment tools and resources aimed at improving the engagement of students with the course. Attained praise from the head of my academic year for suggestions on how to incorporate PebblePad as a useful online resource
Displayed concise communication in written and verbal form when discussing and creating material
COMMENT
After graduating with an MEng in Chemical Engineering from The University of Birmingham, he has spent the past couple of years working as a Project Engineer for Projex Solutions Limited. He has a passion for problem-solving and have been able to apply the knowledge gained from his degree to real-world engineering situations. Alongside this role, he completed a Level 4 Associate Project Manager Apprenticeship, which improved his ability to manage projects within chemical, energy, pharmaceutical and FMCG industries.
For further information please contact Jan Johnston on 01695 570 696 or email janj@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
